answers.answer: You might want to try to post this in the 18-34 pregnancy community.  This is a forum for women who were pregnant and delivering babies in the month of Arpil...I don't believe that the sugar levels have anything to do with the supplements...it sounds like gestational diabetes which could happen to anyone regardless of a family history or any supplements.  Good luck...

question: I am 31 yeas old and am in the 3rd month of npregnancy. I have a hhistory of 2 missed abortions ( one in 2002 and another in 2007). I have one daughter( normal delivery in 2004).   Because of such history I have been recommended by my doctor to take----one injection HUCOG 500 and--progestrone supplement MICROGEST 200 mg twice dailyalthough both my parents are diabetic but till 3 months back my Sugar Levels were absolutely normal.   But suddenly in the 3rd month now my SUGAR LEVELS have gone up (  Fasting 210    and PP  215)Is it because of the progestrone supplement that I have been taking?
title: gestational diabetes
